meanings.definition: Establishing, relating to, or deriving from a standard or norm
meanings.sent1: The teacher explained the normative rules for the class.
meanings.sent2: It is normative behavior to follow the traffic laws.
meanings.sent3: The normative suggestion to wear a hat indoors made everyone chuckle.
meanings.sent4: Her normative approach to gardening transformed the backyard into a colorful paradise.
meanings.sent5: The normative principle of honesty is essential for building trust.

meanings.definition: Prescribing or advocating norms or rules for conduct or belief
meanings.sent1: The company has a normative policy on workplace attire.
meanings.sent2: It is normative to respect others' opinions during discussions.
meanings.sent3: The normative idea of wearing pajamas to work was met with laughter.
meanings.sent4: His normative guidance on time management was like a beacon in the chaos.
meanings.sent5: Following normative guidelines ensures a harmonious environment.
